title: 'Nancy exposed to brutal life as Celtic manager as cup final looms'
summary: BBC Scotland's chief sportswriter, Tom English, dissects Wilfried Nancy's start as Celtic manager with the Premier Sports Cup final looming.

title: Is Saka an alternative to Haaland as captain? The FPL talking point
summary: With Premier League leaders Arsenal hosting bottom club Wolves, is it time to captain Bukayo Saka in your fantasy football team? Our FPL experts give their views.

title: More details about the Motorola Edge 70 Ultra leak
summary: Motorola's Edge 70 line won't be complete until the company launches the Edge 70 Ultra, which leaked in the image you can see below earlier this month. It was already clear that it would be powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 SoC thanks to an earlier Geekbench run, and today some more details â€¦

title: Battocletti bids to retain European Cross Country title - watch on BBC
summary: Team GB and NI select strong squad for Championships, shown across the BBC this weekend.

title: 'There can only be one singer' - my secrets of successful man-management
summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis looks at man-management and how dealing with unhappy players is not the only challenge a manager will face.

title: Rooney 'got death threats' after making Man Utd move
summary: Former England striker Wayne Rooney says he received death threats when he made the move from boyhood club Everton to Manchester United in 2004.

title: John Aiken's journey from cricketer to MAFS expert
summary: How a former first-class cricketer from New Zealand became one of television's most recognisable personalities.

title: Apple is working on a new AirTag and a new HomePod mini
summary: Just as Xiaomi is rumored to be getting into the tracker business, Apple is working on upgrading its AirTag. The new AirTag was apparently supposed to come out this year, but was quietly pushed to the first half of 2026. When it arrives, it will bring with it an improved pairing process, enhanced Pâ€¦

title: You can not blame players for leaving Wales - Hook
summary: Former Wales fly-half James Hook says players should not be blamed for leaving Welsh rugby as Dewi Lake and Jac Morgan consider moving to Gloucester from Ospreys.
